main event: On September 6, 1964, multiple witnesses in Macon, Georgia reported observing unidentified flying objects in the sky during the early morning hours.
interesting points: The first object observed was a reddish star-like object that split into two and disappeared., The first object had a glowing appearance and a beam of light in front of it, visible for only a few seconds., After the first sighting, two star-like objects were observed moving side to side for about two hours., Weather conditions were reported clear with no unusual meteorological activity that might explain the sightings., One witness reported seeing a shooting star that could possibly relate to the first object sighted.
sighted object: reddish glowing egg-shaped object, two star-like objects
witness description: Four individuals reported the sighting, having just returned from a fishing trip, all appeared to be sober and of sound mind.
